cyclone.name: ELSA
cyclone.current_location: about 110 miles SE of Isla Beata, Dominican Republic
cyclone.trajectory: Racing west-northwest across the central Caribbean, then expected to slow and curve northwest across Cuba and the Florida Straits before turning north-northeast along or just inland of the U.S. Southeast coast late Day-4/Day-5

weather_observation.watch_coast: Hurricane/Tropical-storm watches confined to Hispaniola, Cuba and surrounding Caribbean islands
weather_observation.warning_coast: Warnings limited to southern Hispaniola, Jamaica and portions of Cuba – no U.S. Atlantic coast warnings in effect
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Projected impact corridor from the Florida Keys northward along the Southeast coast through the Carolinas; mid-Atlantic (including Virginia) only marginally affected late in the 5-day period
weather_observation.wind: Low probability (3%) of tropical-storm-force gusts by late Thursday; otherwise breezy conditions
weather_observation.storm_surge: None expected with current forecast track; only minor tidal anomalies possible
weather_observation.rainfall: Bands could bring 1–3 inches of rain as the weakening system passes south and east of the port late next week
weather_observation.other_hazards: Long-period swells could elevate seas and create hazardous pilotage conditions Thursday–Friday even without damaging winds
